item.title: TwoTrees Sapphire Pro Drag Chain Mounts Take Two
item.description:
This is a small change to the original posted by G4Cab. I removed the Chain STL's, they are just not worth it. I lengthened the Cable Management for the 10x20 Chain setup and combined the cable management for the 7X7. You can purchase a 7x7 and 10x20 chain on Amazon for less that 25 bucks. I used these

7x7 Chain
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01M1EC6MO?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2_dt_b_product_details

10x10 Chain ( Doesn't lay completely flat, needs coaxing)
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07WK15X25?ref=ppx_yo2_dt_b_product_details&th=1

I would run the printhead and both of the profiles at 50% infill and 20% on everything else.

I have also positioned the prints how I printed them. I would suggest full supports on everything but the 7x7 Hotbed which I have labeled no supports.

I also highly suggest printing the 10x20 Printhead in PETG. There are 2 different variants, one with BL and one without.
item.author: falkien

item.title: Screwdriver Case
item.description:
I ordered this screwdriver set after my old-school metal "eyeglass" screwdriver gave me a metal splinter in my thumb. However, the screwdriver kit did not come with a case.

Because I have a Prusa Mini and the screwdrivers were so long (~170mm or so), I wasn't able to draft up a "traditional" hinged box. I opted to create a cylinder, with the following design goals:

  • Printed in multiple parts, but it shouldn't feel like yet. It should feel sturdy and solid, not flimsy.
  • No supports! I have nothing against supports, but I thought it would be fun to figure out how to make this without the need for any supports whatsoever.
  • Should be durable. I should be able to chuck it in a toolbag and know it won't break and the screwdrivers won't come loose.
  • Optimize for the most common screwdriver sizes in the set. It doesn't need to hold everything the kit comes with.

In the end, I came up with this design. It has the following features:

  • All parts slide together into 2 final "large" pieces.
  • The gap tolerances between the male and female parts allow the pieces to slide together, but not come apart. I had a success rate of about 20% when I actually wanted to pull pieces apart as I was testing fit.
  • The outer case has a twist-lock mechanism to pull the two pieces together snugly and hold them, but still twist apart with minimal pressure.
  • The screwdrivers are held securely, but pop out easily when pressure is applied under them
  • The sizes are easily identifiable on the "hilt" of the inner case. The sizes correspond to 3=3mm, 2=2mm, and 1=1.5mm.

In the end, I had a lot of fun with this design, and hope you enjoy putting it together too!

If you'd like to modify this, feel free to clone my Tinkercad deisgn.
item.author: shawalli

item.description:

item.title: Ender 3 Pro Runout Spacer for Dual Gear extruder
item.description: This is a Spacer to raise up the runout sensor if you are using the actual creality runout sensor or bracket spacer raises sensor 8.75 mm so you will need to get some m3 x 25 or 30 screws I found mine m3 x 25 at local Menards the actual Dimensions of the spacer are 38mm x 44mm x 8.75mm Took Just under 1 hour to print
item.author: AlexWolfe

item.title: Dewalt DWP611 mounting plate for Craftsman 25444 router table
item.description:
This mounting plate lets you use a Dewalt DWP611 router with a Craftsman 25444 router table.

  • The mounting plate is 1/4 inch thick. Same as the base plate that comes with the router.
  • To mount the plate to the router table I used M4-20 machine screws and M4 nuts.
  • To mount the plate to the router you can reuse the base plate screws that come with the router.

It works really well and is a way cheaper option than the universal mounting plates you can buy online.

I have also added the Fusion360 and STEP file so you can adjust it for other router / router table configurations.
item.author: fantadler

item.title: Double Barrel Airsoft 40mm grenade Launcher
item.description:
Based on this file : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:4582185?fbclid=IwAR3ZJ0GTDUUAMS9pXAbxvatr_-GWf4cpXSsELv6TNXwtkOzZL0lha49WwEE

EN:
Double barrel grenade launcher gun for airsoft.

You will need :

  • X2 M6 75 or 80mm screws (to be re-cut if necessary)
  • X2 M6 nut (Blind nut for more style)
  • X1 M3 Screw+Nut
  • X1 Spring (pen spring)

Not yet tried, open to suggestion for modification

FR:
Pistolet lance grenade à double canon pour l'airsoft.

Vous aurez besoin de :

  • X2 Vis M6 de 75 ou 80mm (à recouper si besoin)
  • X2 Ecrou M6 (Ecrou borgne pour plus de style)
  • X1 Vis+ecrou M3
  • X1 Ressort (ressort de stylo)

Pas encore essayer, ouvert au suggestion de modification
item.author: Nain

item.title: FliteTest G44 Widgeon wing float & strut
item.description:
This is a replacement wing float for the FliteTest Grumman Widgeon. I broke off one of the struts on a hard landing and found out there are no replacements. So here it is. It's not an exact copy. It's a little rough and heavier than the original. But it works and looks pretty good. Finishing is optional.

I used TinkerCad because I'm lazy. I'm sure someone can do a better model with a little more effort.

It can be printed as the whole strut & float unit with minimal supports or the strut and float can be printed separately and assembled. Printing the strut & float as one unit makes the lightest combination. I use 8% fill and try to keep the walls thin (2-3 layers).

item.title: Prusa i3 X Belt Tentioner
item.description:
My version of the belt tensioner for the Prusa i3 / Anet A6. I didn't like the tolerance's of some of the others and also had issues with my smooth rod protruding out the end. I got in Solidworks and redesigned some of the nut areas and widths along with opening up the ends to allow for the 8mm smooth rods to extend through.

Here is what you need:

2 - M3 nuts
1 - M3 washer
1 M3 x 20 bolt

item.author: Lrroberts87

item.title: Shelf Queen Axles for Crawler
item.description:
Hi guys,

If you have a sweet sweet crawler body shell that you hardly ever run and you're like me, it spends a lot of time sitting on the shelf, alone and forlorn. Why not build a cheap chassis to put it on? These axle housings are dirt cheap if you have a 3D printer. They probably don't make any sense if you don't because you can just buy a set of cheap axles. All you need to make these work really well is a set of cheap drive shafts and some screws.

Dirt cheap drive shafts (the fronts are notoriously weak): https://www.injora.com/products/metal-axle-dogbone-shaft-gear-for-injora-90046-axle-replacement-parts?variant=39449036095536

Still cheap but much better fronts: https://www.injora.com/products/metal-cvd-dogbone-shaft-axle-gear-for-injora-yqcq-02-axle?variant=39727162753072

I would buy the better quality drive shafts: a) if you have an SCX10 and b) you think you might use them in the future for any reason.

You will also need:

4 M2.5x16mm screws to secure the back half of the axle shell
4 M2x8mm screws to secure the pinion carrier

For axles with screw on link mounts:

8 M3x8mm screws to secure link mounts to axle

You can make do with less screws or slightly different lengths, just be sure to check the fit.

I strongly recommend drilling thru holes and pre-tapping screw holes (run a screw into each hole with the parts loose).

Assembly video: https://youtu.be/2pGlL0M1Tlg

Most of the plastic parts from the functional axles I've made are usable as Shelf queen parts but some have bearing cups you will need to account for (use a fake bearing for shelf queen purposes).

For functional axles I would print them at a heat wear stringing begins with near 100% infill. For pure shelf queen, use whatever settings you like.

Parts options (for 2 axles each):

BOM1 (integral link mount on axle) NOT recommended:

2x Axle_L1_Pinion_Side_SQ.stl
2x Axle_L1_Cover_SQ.stl

2x V2_Pinion_Carrier_SQ.stl
2x Axle_Input_Shaft_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Spool_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Rear_Bearing_SQ.stl
2x Rear_Outer_5x11x4_F.stl
1x Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl

4 M2.5x16mm screws to secure the back half of the axle shell
4 M2x8mm screws to secure the pinion carrier

BOM2 (Screw on link mounts):

2x Axle_L2_Pinion_Side_SQ.stl
2x Axle_L2_Cover_SQ.stl
4x Link_Mount_SQ.stl

2x V2_Pinion_Carrier_SQ.stl
2x Axle_Input_Shaft_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Spool_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Rear_Bearing_SQ.stl
2x Rear_Outer_5x11x4_F.stl
1x Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl

4 M2.5x16mm screws to secure the back half of the axle shell
4 M2x8mm screws to secure the pinion carrier
8 M3x8mm screws to secure link mounts to axle

BOM3 (Screw on link mounts AND removeable diff cover):

2x Axle_L2_Pinion_Side_SQ.stl
2x Axle_L2_V2_Cover_SQ.stl
2x Axle_L2_V2_Diff_Cover_SQ.stl
4x Link_Mount_SQ.stl

2x V2_Pinion_Carrier_SQ.stl
2x Axle_Input_Shaft_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Spool_SQ.stl
2x Fake_Rear_Bearing_SQ.stl
2x Rear_Outer_5x11x4_F.stl
1x Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Left_Caster_Block_SQ.stl
1x Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl
1x mirrored Injora_Knuckle_SQ.stl

4 M2.5x16mm screws to secure the back half of the axle shell
4 M2x8mm screws to secure the pinion carrier
8 M3x8mm screws to secure link mounts to axle

Wrench to drive or drive to wrench?
item.author: WrenchToDrive
